meanings.definition: Officially register as a member of a course, college, or group.
meanings.sent1: She enrolled in the art class to learn how to paint.
meanings.sent2: He enrolled in the university to pursue a degree in engineering.
meanings.sent3: The cat enrolled in the mouse-catching program but ended up napping instead.
meanings.sent4: Her mind enrolled in a world of creativity as she painted her first masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: Enrolling in the cooking class made her culinary skills flourish.

meanings.definition: Record or enter in a list or record.
meanings.sent1: The librarian enrolled the new books into the library system.
meanings.sent2: He enrolled the attendees' names in the event registration book.
meanings.sent3: The computer mistakenly enrolled the wrong data into the spreadsheet.
meanings.sent4: His memory enrolled the beautiful scenery into his mental album.
meanings.sent5: Enrolling the expenses in the budget sheet helped him track his spending.

meanings.definition: Enlist or sign up for a service or program.
meanings.sent1: She enrolled in the volunteer program to help the community.
meanings.sent2: He enrolled in the fitness classes to improve his health.
meanings.sent3: The dog accidentally enrolled in the obedience training class.
meanings.sent4: His heart enrolled in the mission to spread kindness and positivity.
meanings.sent5: Enrolling in the language course broadened her communication skills.
